    <!-- PlaceHolder tag prevents inline radmenu.ClientID code below clashing with Utility.EnsureScriptManager(this); -->
    <script>

        $(document).ready(function () {
            giveAllMenuLinksAUniqueIdentifier();
            $(".rmLink").on("keydown", setSpacebarToOpenMenus);
        });

        function giveAllMenuLinksAUniqueIdentifier() {
            //Give all menu items a unique attribute value so that I can identify them when spacebar is clicked. Same 'menunumber' attribute is set in .aspx code on menu items.
            var index = 0;
            $(".telerik_main_menu li.rmItem a.rmLink").each(function (index) {
                $(this).attr("menunumber", index);
            });
        }

        function setSpacebarToOpenMenus(e) {
            //Open submenus on spacebar press. 
            var theKey = e.which;
            if (theKey == 32) { // 32 is keycode for spacebar. 
                var menuNumber = $(this).attr("menunumber");
                var menu = $find("ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl01_radmenu");
                var menuItem = menu.findItemByAttribute("menunumber", menuNumber);
                var submenuItems = menuItem.get_items();
                if (submenuItems.get_count() > 0) {
                    if (menuItem.get_isOpen() == false) {
                        menuItem.open();
                        e.preventDefault();
                    };
                };
            };
        };

        function ClickItem(menu, args) {
            //Event set in OnClientItemClicking="ClickItem";
            //When user clicks (presses Enter key) a menu item, if submenu is not open, then open it; otherwise navigate to the item's link. 
            var item = args.get_item();
            var submenuItems = item.get_items();
            if (submenuItems.get_count() > 0) {
                //If submenu is closed, then open it; otherwise click the menu item link. 
                if (item.get_isOpen() == false) {
                    args.set_cancel(true); //Cancel the default click action so that it doesn't trigger the menu item's navigation link.
                    item.open();
                }
                else {
                    if (typeof item.redirectToLink == 'undefined') {
                        item.redirectToLink = true;
                        item.click();
                    } else {
                        delete item.redirectToLink;
                    }
                }
            }
        }

    </script>

        $("a.mm-subopen").html("<span class=\"offScreen\">Expand menu item</span>");

class="col-md-9 col-md-9 col-md-push-3"><div id="subpage_content" role="main"><h1>Social Security Number</h1><div class="ptl_page"><div class="ptl_col_1"><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><div id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl07_divContent"><ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li1">What is a Social Security Number?</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li2">Who is eligible for a Social Security Number?</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li3">How do I obtain a Social Security Number?</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li4">How should I handle my Social Security Number?</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li5">Do I need a Social Security Number to open a bank
    account?</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l2 level1 lfo1"><a href="#li6">Can I apply for an Illinois driver's license
    without a Social Security Number?</a></li>
</ul>
<p><a name="li1" style="padding-top: 90px; margin-top: -90px;"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center margin-top: -90px;" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">What is a Social Security Number?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Social Security Numbers (SSNs)
are used to report a person&rsquo;s wages to the U.S. government and to determine a
person&rsquo;s eligibility for Social Security and other government services. For
more information, see the Social Security Administration&rsquo;s (SSA) publication,&nbsp;<a href="https://www.ssa.gov/pubs/EN-05-10096.pdf">Social Security Numbers for Noncitizens</a>.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);"></span></strong></p>
<p><a name="li2"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">Who is eligible for a Social Security Number?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">SSA issues SSNs to people
lawfully admitted to the U.S. on a temporary basis who have authorization to work
by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). In general, international
students and scholars must have an authorized, paying job to be eligible for an
SSN.</span><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);"></span></strong></p>
<p><a name="li3"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">How do I obtain a Social Security Number?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">In order to obtain an SSN you
must submit an application to a <a href="https://secure.ssa.gov/ICON/main.jsp#officeResults">Social
Security Administration (SSA) office</a>. The contents of your
application will depend on your specific immigration status, as described
below. </span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: gray;">International students, scholars,
and employees working at UIC should consult with your department administrator
or Human Resources contact for additional guidance before starting this
process.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">When should I go to the SSA
office</span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">OIS strongly recommends that you
wait at minimum one business day from the date you arrive to the U.S. to apply
for your SSN. SSA must verify your immigration status in order to accept your
application and it takes one business day for federal databases to communicate
information about your arrival and status to SSA. <em>Applying early may result in significant delay of receiving your SSN.</em></span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Where is the SSA office?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">While you may visit any <a href="https://secure.ssa.gov/ICON/main.jsp">SSA office location</a>, the
offices nearest UIC campuses are familiar with processing the applications of
UIC students, scholars, and staff. </span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">SSA
    nearest UIC&rsquo;s Chicago Campus</li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">605 West Washington Boulevard<br>
</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Chicago, IL
60661</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">1-800-772-1213</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">SSA
    nearest UIC&rsquo;s Peoria Campus</li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">815 West
Pioneer Parkway</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Peoria, IL
61615</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">1-877-319-6039</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&nbsp;</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">SSA
    nearest UIC&rsquo;s Rockford Campus</li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">502 East
Jefferson Street</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Rockford,
IL 61107</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">1-877-628-6570</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&nbsp;</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">What should I bring to the
SSA office</span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">?<span style="text-decoration: underline;"></span></span></p>
<ol style="margin-top:0in" start="1" type="1">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3">Passport</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3"><a href="https://i94.cbp.dhs.gov/I94/#/home">I-94
    record</a></li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3">Address where your card can be successfully
    delivered to you 2-6 weeks from your application date</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
    mso-list:l0 level1 lfo3">Additional documentation</li>
    <ol style="margin-top:0in" start="1" type="a">
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">F-1 sponsored by UIC and working on-campus &nbsp;&ndash; Form I-20 and&nbsp;<span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"><a href="/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=799552">Completed Social Security Support Letter for F-1 International        Students</a></span>.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">F-1 status on CPT &ndash; Form I-20 with current CPT
        authorization and employer&rsquo;s job offer letter.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">F-1 status on OPT &ndash; Form I-20, USCIS issued EAD,
        and employer&rsquo;s job offer letter.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">J-1 Exchange Visitor sponsored by UIC (student
        or scholar) &ndash; Form DS-2019 and completed&nbsp;<span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);"><a href="/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=799554">Social        Security Support Letter for J Exchange Visitor</a></span>.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">J-1 Exchange Visitor sponsored by a third party
        &ndash; Form DS-2019 and additional support documentation as advised by program
        sponsor (e.g. IIE Fulbright).</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">J-2 status &ndash; Form DS-2019, USCIS issued EAD, and
        employer&rsquo;s job offer letter.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">H-1B, TN, or O-1 status &ndash; Form I-797.</li>
        <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:gray;margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
        mso-list:l0 level2 lfo3">Pending Permanent Residency &ndash; USCIS issued EAD.</li>
    </ol>
</ol>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">What happens after I submit
my application</span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">? </span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: gray;">Once you apply, SSA will process
your application and, if approved, mail you a card containing your unique and
permanent Social Security Number (SSN). It can take 2-6 weeks from the date of
application for the card to arrive by mail. After you receive your card, please
submit a copy directly to your employer.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Most likely you will receive a
Social Security card that has the notation, &ldquo;VALID FOR WORK ONLY WITH DHS AUTHORIZATION.&rdquo;
SSA issues this type of card to people lawfully admitted to the United States
on a temporary basis who have authorization to work by the Department of
Homeland Security (DHS).</span></p>
<p><a name="li4"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">How should I handle my Social Security Number?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Your Social Security Number
(SSN) is sensitive, personal identification information. In general, you should
not carry your Social Security card in your wallet on a daily basis. It may
help to memorize your number and only carry the card when you know it will be
needed for a specific purpose. Common scenarios in which your SSN will be
requested are:</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">When an employer is
setting up payroll and tax paperwork at a new job.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">When setting up a
new bank account, opening a credit card, or applying for a loan.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">When a business
needs to check your credit in order to apply for an apartment, sign up for
utilities, or get a contract-based mobile phone plan.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">However, since SSNs are commonly
used in identity theft scams, it&rsquo;s a good idea to ask questions before deciding
to share your number in-person, on a form, or online. For example if someone
wants you to share your or your child&rsquo;s SSN, you can ask: </span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Why do they need
your SSN?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">How will your SSN be
used?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">How will protect
your SSN and other personal information?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">What happens if you
don&rsquo;t share your SSN?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-left:.75in;text-indent:-.5in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo5"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&bull;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 7pt; line-height: normal; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Is there other
identifying information you can provide in place of the SSN?</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">If you don&rsquo;t feel comfortable
with the answers to these questions, or you are being asked to share your SSN
over public Wi-Fi to a non-encrypted website, it may be best to protect your
SSN and not share it. </span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Information adapted from the
Federal Trade Commission&rsquo;s site, <a href="https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/articles/0272-how-keep-your-personal-information-secure">How to Keep
your Personal Information Secure</a>.</span><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);"></span></strong></p>
<p><a name="li5"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">Do I need a Social Security Number to open a bank account?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">U.S. financial institutions are
required to verify the identity of every individual who opens a bank account.
In compliance with federal regulations, all banks operating in the U.S. have
established Customer Identification Programs (CIP) that they are to follow for
anyone who seeks to open an account. While the specifics of the CIP may vary
from one bank to another, Department of Treasury regulations found at 31 CFR &sect;
103.121 set forth the following minimal information that the banks must obtain
from you before allowing you to open an account:</span></p>
<ol style="margin-top:0in" start="1" type="1">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4">Your name</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4">Your date of
    birth</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4">Your street
    address &ndash; no P.O. Box</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l1 level1 lfo4">An
    identification number</li>
</ol>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">The regulations 31 CFR &sect;
103.121(b)(i)A)(4)(ii) clarify that for a non-U.S. person the identification
number shall be one or more of the following:</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0in" type="disc">
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">taxpayer
    identification number (ITIN)</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">passport
    number and country of issuance</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">alien
    identification card number</li>
    <li class="MsoNormal" style="color:#7F7F7F;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2">number and
    country of issuance of any other government-issued document evidencing
    nationality or residence and bearing a photograph or similar safeguard</li>
</ul>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">It is important to remember that
banks establish their own customer identification programs and may ask for
additional documentation than is described above because they are ultimately
responsible for establishing the identity of their customers.</span></p>
<p><a name="li6"></a></p>
<p class="MsoNormal" style="text-align:center" align="center"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; line-height: 115%; color: rgb(64, 190, 160);">Can I apply for an Illinois Driver&rsquo;s License without a
Social Security Number?</span></strong></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">A Social Security Number is not
required to obtain a State of Illinois Driver&rsquo;s License. Internationals (F-1,
F-2, J-1, J-2, among others) in Illinois may obtain a Temporary Visitor Driver&rsquo;s
License (TVDL) from various locations in the state. To apply, you will need to
visit the Social Security Administration to request a letter stating that you
are not eligible for an SSN, this is known as a Form L-676. If, however, you
are eligible for a SSN, then you must apply for and receive the SSN before
applying for a state driver&rsquo;s license.</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">For more information, visit the
Social Security Administration web site: http://ssa.gov/ssnumber/</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">&nbsp;</span></p>
